result.execSummary:
The defendant Heriberto Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 5-24-2016.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heriberto Perez

records.addlTxt: 12/4/15 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Heriberto Perez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

Defendant ordered to serve 3 months in the House of Correction; forthwith. 
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 5-24-2016.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Heriberto Perez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
Case adjourned in branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Heriberto Perez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Heriberto Perez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: City of Milwaukee Police Department Officer Manuel Molina. Testimony closed. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court denied the defense motion. Court reminded the defendant to follow all the conditions of bail that were previously set. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense out ill all parties stipulate to adjourn the motion hearing to 08-26-2015 at 01:30 in Branch 23. All parties are advised effective August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.

Defendant Heriberto Perez in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 46.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
